name: multitask
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to do more than one thing at a time: There's a stereotype that women tend to multitask better than men do. Young people who multitask while driving slow their reaction time to that of an 80-year-old. See
multitaskingCompare
monotask
More examplesFewer examplesThey couldn't multitask, and I needed people who could.People who multitask never complete those tasks as fast as they think they do.The ability to multitask is a key to handling it all.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to do several different jobs at the same time: When you're working under pressure, it's important to be able to multitask and prioritize.
IT when a computer multitasks, it operates several different programs at the same time: Saying that a netbook can't multitask is like saying a compact car can't carry passengers.
